node.title: Katherine named 'ground zero' for COVID in the NT on day of record case numbers
node.description: As the NT'sÂ current outbreak increases by 16 cases, new CHO directions order anyone who has left the Katherine area since November 29 to get a COVID test within the next three days.
node.content:
["The Northern Territory has recorded 17 new COVID-19 cases overnight, with 16 linked to the current outbreak.", "It is the Territory's highest daily case\u00a0increase so far in the pandemic", "Fourteen of the new cases\u00a0are from households in four streets in Katherine East, where a testing blitz had been taking place.", "Of those\u00a014 cases, eight are children under 12, five are aged in their 20s, 30s or 40s, and one is a 70-year-old woman.", "The remaining two cases \u2014 a teenage boy and a man in his 70s \u2014 are already\u00a0in quarantine.", "There was also one positive case from an international repatriation flight.", "\"It's a big number but it's a number that we expected,\" Deputy Chief Minister Nicole\u00a0Manison said.", "\"The blitz is working. We are finding the cases that we thought were there.\"", "The new cases bring the total number in the current outbreak to 87.", "Ms Manison said authorities had also detected one more possible case \u2014 a Binjari resident who was visiting Timber Creek.", "\"He has returned a provisional positive result, but that still needs to be confirmed,\" she said.", "The man is in isolation and there are no health\u00a0directions in place for Timber Creek.", "
Katherine named 'ground zero for COVID'
", "Ms Manison said a new Chief Health Officer direction had been issued for people who have spent time in Katherine, Binjari or Rockhole since Monday, November 29 and have since left the Katherine area.", "Those people are being directed to get a COVID test within the\u00a0next three days.", "", "
Nicole\u00a0Manison says the new CHO direction \"effectively means all of Katherine is now an exposure site\".(ABC News: Callan McLaughlin)
", "She said authorities were now effectively treating all of Katherine as an exposure site.", "\"Obviously Katherine has been the ground zero for COVID in the Territory,\" she said.", "\"The issue we now have is the high likelihood that it is expected that it is spreading from Katherine into other communities.", "\"If we do get cases in some of these communities in the next few days, there is a 99 per cent chance that it would have come from Katherine.", "\"If you have been in Katherine at\u00a0any point in the past two weeks in those areas and you are now outside of Katherine, please go get a test in the next three days. \"", "People covered by the new testing requirements do not need to isolate.", "
Authorities brace for more remote cases
", "Ms Manison flagged that there was a \"very strong chance\" remote communities would record COVID cases in coming days.", "Yesterday authorities announced\u00a0positive wastewater had been detected\u00a0in Tennant Creek and five remote communities near Katherine \u2013 Bulla, Daguragu, Pigeonhole, Kalkarindji and Lajamanu.", "Positive cases, Ms Manison said today, would likely require lockout restrictions to be placed on communities where cases were detected.", "\"For the other communities where we have received positive wastewater\u00a0results in the past few days, we are expecting to get a new round of results back at the end of the day,\" she said.", "\"I want to flag that there is a very strong chance that there will be communities that have active cases.", "\"So it is likely that we are going to have to\u00a0scale our responses to some of these communities to a lockout in the next day or two.", "\"So that means locking down people who are not fully vaccinated. And I want these communities to be prepared for that.\"", "Ms Manison said all residents in the remote community of Beswick, which entered a lockout on Saturday after a positive wastewater detection, should be tested by the end of the day.", "She said a rapid assessment team took 305 tests in the community yesterday.", "However she said only five people came forward for testing in Tennant Creek.", "\"Frankly that is not good enough,\" she said.", "\"When we have positive wastewater, we really do need a higher rate of testing.", "\"I really urge everybody in Tennant Creek, if you have the slightest of symptoms, it is enough reason to go forward and get a COVID test. Please get tested.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
